page.title: 02DANIEL ADAMSON COACH HOUSE
page.content: The {Coach}House was built in 1825. Recently it has been restored with the aid of grants from{Sedgefield {District Council}, and is now used as a{Community}Centre.Although all of the rooms are small, many activities take place throughout the day and during the evening. These activities include soft toy making, 'proddy mat' making (which is a old art of rug making common in the North East in days gone by when floor coverings were made by 'prodding' short pieces of material through a hesian backing),sketching, art, wine making as well as activities for the young. The Centre has a leader who is assisted by 3 part time teachers.Environmental trails of Shildon have been devised by the staff of the centre,and are used by all of the Primary schools in the town.
